title: Research Project
content: I'm in my first year and seeing my decent experience with some programming concepts i was offered a research opportunity under a professor in PES. But i didnt quite understand the concept even though the subject looks interesting. What will I a first year be knowledgeable enough to research on? The professor did give me a topic and ask me to read up on it and said he would answer every doubt, but i would like somebody with such experience to please weigh in on this as i have no clue what i need to do.

comments.body:
Sorry, couldn't get to this earlier. 

This is a great opportunity that you shouldn't pass up! It doesn't matter if you do not know anything right now. If you are interested in the subject (which you say you are), and your prof has invited you, go for it! It will be a valuable experience and you will learn/pickup the skills over time. Not many people get an invitation like this from a prof to work on research here, you should make the most of this opportunity that you have :)
